Text: Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas Cc PST Forwarded by Robert BensonCorpEnron on PM Chris CT PM ToRobert NRON cc SubjectWhy One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas Forwarded by Chris DorlandHOUECT on PM Dan Dorland AM ToPaul CT Jan CT Jeff CT Dave CT Garrett CT Stephane BrodeurCAL CT Chris CT cc SubjectWhy One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas yahoocommentdetoxhtml Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas By Peter Eavis Senior Columnist Originally posted at PM ET on RealMoneycom A small research boutique with a reputation for rigorous analysis is tell ing clients to quickly dump Enron ENE NYSE news believing that the e nergy trading giants earnings will fall well short of Wall Streets f orecasts Cambridge Massbased Off Wall Street led by analyst Mark Robe rts thinks Enrons earnings will fall cents short of the consensus estimate of The firm also believes Enron stock should trade around nearly below Wednesdays The firms page report publis hed May highlights Enrons declining profitability and increasing levera ge and suggests that the company should trade on the same sort of multiple as a trading firm like Goldman Sachs GS NYSE news which has a p ricetoearnings ratio about half of Enrons times OWS also alleges tha t Enrons earnings quality is poor and that key parts of its financial stat ements are confusing and opaque Houstonbased Enron didnt comment by pub lication time on elements of the report that Detox sent the company An en ergy analyst who is bullish on Enrons outlook says the OWS report contains fundamental misunderstandings about the energy market and Enrons business model but he says the report does include some groundbreaking and valid insights The analysts firm doesnt give stock recommendations Economi es of Scale Why care what Off Wall Street writes compared with say analy sts at Merrill Lynch MER NYSE news For one OWS has an excellent tra ck record Particularly sweet was when the tech stocks it had bashed came crashing down It has also shown itself to be well ahead of the curve recommending that clients sell etailer pricelinecom PCLN Nasdaq news in June when faith in Internet stocks was at its blindest and thei r prices at their most insane Pulling Back Enron retreats after long rally Enron with its domination of a burgeoning energy market annual re venue of over billion and impressive earnings growth can hardly be ra nked alongside the likes of priceline But OWS thinks Enron is set for a pr ecipitous drop nonetheless Why OWSs main beef is that key profitability measures are in decline Margins on Enrons pretax operating earnings whi ch the companys earnings releases call IBIT or income before interest ta xes and other items are falling Total IBIT of million in the first q uarter amounted to only of the billion in revenue for the period compared with a margin in the fourth quarter and in the yeare arlier period Revenue in the first quarter was nearly quadrupled from the yearearlier period yet IBIT rose only This shrinkage is due to lower margin trading income making up an increasingly large share of Enrons rev enue base OWS thus calculates that for the remainder of Enron needs to generate an extra billion in revenue for each additional penny it m akes over its EPS of to reach analysts expectation of T he energy analyst counters that OWS apparently hasnt grasped how Enron can continue to increase earnings even when margins shrink It does so simply by increasing volumes as the energy market balloons in size In other words margins may decline but since revenues are so much higher earnings stil l go up Illustrating this firstquarter EPS of cents was ahea d of the yearago figure even though the IBIT margin shrank by percent age points The analyst thinks Enron will make per share in Gr owing On You In addition the huge growth in the energy market that has so helped Enron is likely to continue for several years according to the anal yst He notes that roughly of the electricity available in the US sti ll isnt traded in a market Eventually it will be part of a competitive e nvironment but itll take five to years says the analyst And he beli eves the extreme volatility in energyrelated commodities that has also ben efited Enron will exist for longer than OWS projects Still OWSs point o n profitability is bolstered by other profit measures Return on capital n et income as a percentage of equity plus debt was in down on s and well below the returns on capital at Duke DUK NYSE n ews Dynegy DYN NYSE news and even Goldman Even Enron bulls will admit that its financials are hard to follow For ex ample it doesnt give a gross margin number for its wholesale services or trading business which accounts for of revenue But one area of the companys financial statements registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission that consistently bugs analysts is the part that describes Enron s related party transactions which are the deals it does with entities th at have some sort of link to the firm In fact one of the related entities that Enron has traded with is headed by Enrons CFO Andrew Fastow The en ergy analyst comments Why are they doing this Its just inappropriate The reason for maintaining these hardtofollow related party deals has be en a source of speculation But OWS analysis shows how a sales of optical f iber to a related party may have been used to goose earnings in the second quarter of Estimated profits from the socalled dark fiber optical c able without the gear to send data over it transaction allowed Enron to be at analysts secondearnings earnings estimate by cents a share rather t han missing by cents How soon before Wall Street follows Off Wall Stree t on Enron

Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas Cc Forwarded by Robert BensonCorpEnron on PM Chris CT PM To Robert NRON cc Subject Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas Forwarded by Chris DorlandHOUECT on PM Dan Dorland AM To Paul CT Jan CT Jeff CT Dave CT Garrett CT Stephane CT Chris CT cc Subject Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas yahoocommentdetoxhtml Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas By Peter Eavis Senior Columnist Originally posted at PM ET on RealMoneycom A small research boutique with a reputation for rigorous analysis is telling clients to quickly dump Enron ENENYSE news believing that the energy trading giants earnings will fall well short of Wall Streets forecasts Cambridge Massbased Off Wall Street led by analyst Mark Roberts thinks Enrons earnings will fall cents short of the consensus estimate of The firm also believes Enron stock should trade around nearly below Wednesdays The firms page report published May highlights Enrons declining profitability and increasing leverage and suggests that the company should trade on the same sort of multiple as a trading firm like Goldman Sachs GS NYSE news which has a pricetoearnings ratio about half of Enrons times OWS also alleges that Enrons earnings quality is poor and that key parts of its financial statements are confusing and opaque Houstonbased Enron didnt comment by publication time on elements of the report that Detox sent the company An energy analyst who is bullish on Enrons outlook says the OWS report contains fundamental misunderstandings about the energy market and Enrons business model but he says the report does include some groundbreaking and valid insights The analysts firm doesnt give stock recommendations Economies of Scale Why care what Off Wall Street writes compared with say analysts at Merrill Lynch MERNYSE news For one OWS has an excellent track record Particularly sweet was when the tech stocks it had bashed came crashing down It has also shown itself to be well ahead of the curve recommending that clients sell etailer pricelinecom PCLNNasdaq news in June when faith in Internet stocks was at its blindest and their prices at their most insane Pulling Back Enron retreats after long rally Enron with its domination of a burgeoning energy market annual revenue of over billion and impressive earnings growth can hardly be ranked alongside the likes of priceline But OWS thinks Enron is set for a precipitous drop nonetheless Why OWSs main beef is that key profitability measures are in decline Margins on Enrons pretax operating earnings which the companys earnings releases call IBIT or income before interest taxes and other items are falling Total IBIT of million in the first quarter amounted to only of the billion in revenue for the period compared with a margin in the fourth quarter and in the yearearlier period Revenue in the first quarter was nearly quadrupled from the yearearlier period yet IBIT rose only This shrinkage is due to lowermargin trading income making up an increasingly large share of Enrons revenue base OWS thus calculates that for the remainder of Enron needs to generate an extra billion in revenue for each additional penny it makes over its EPS of to reach analysts expectation of The energy analyst counters that OWS apparently hasnt grasped how Enron can continue to increase earnings even when margins shrink It does so simply by increasing volumes as the energy market balloons in size In other words margins may decline but since revenues are so much higher earnings still go up Illustrating this firstquarter EPS of cents was ahead of the yearago figure even though the IBIT margin shrank by percentage points The analyst thinks Enron will make per share in Growing On You In addition the huge growth in the energy market that has so helped Enron is likely to continue for several years according to the analyst He notes that roughly of the electricity available in the US still isnt traded in a market Eventually it will be part of a competitive environment but itll take five to years says the analyst And he believes the extreme volatility in energyrelated commodities that has also benefited Enron will exist for longer than OWS projects Still OWSs point on profitability is bolstered by other profit measures Return on capital net income as a percentage of equity plus debt was in down on s and well below the returns on capital at Duke DUKNYSE news Dynegy DYNNYSE news and even Goldman Even Enron bulls will admit that its financials are hard to follow For example it doesnt give a gross margin number for its wholesale services or trading business which accounts for of revenue But one area of the companys financial statements registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission that consistently bugs analysts is the part that describes Enrons related party transactions which are the deals it does with entities that have some sort of link to the firm In fact one of the related entities that Enron has traded with is headed by Enrons CFO Andrew Fastow The energy analyst comments Why are they doing this Its just inappropriate The reason for maintaining these hardtofollow related party deals has been a source of speculation But OWS analysis shows how a sales of optical fiber to a related party may have been used to goose earnings in the second quarter of Estimated profits from the socalled dark fiber optical cable without the gear to send data over it transaction allowed Enron to beat analysts secondearnings earnings estimate by cents a share rather than missing by cents How soon before Wall Street follows Off Wall Street on Enron

Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas Cc Forwarded by Robert BensonCorpEnron on PM Chris CT PM To Robert NRON cc Subject Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas Forwarded by Chris DorlandHOUECT on PM Dan Dorland AM To Paul CT Jan CT Jeff CT Dave CT Garrett CT Stephane CT Chris CT cc Subject Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas yahoocommentdetoxhtml Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas By Peter Eavis Senior Columnist Originally posted at PM ET on RealMoneycom A small research boutique with a reputation for rigorous analysis is telling clients to quickly dump Enron ENENYSE news believing that the energy trading giants earnings will fall well short of Wall Streets forecasts Cambridge Massbased Off Wall Street led by analyst Mark Roberts thinks Enrons earnings will fall cents short of the consensus estimate of The firm also believes Enron stock should trade around nearly below Wednesdays The firms page report published May highlights Enrons declining profitability and increasing leverage and suggests that the company should trade on the same sort of multiple as a trading firm like Goldman Sachs GS NYSE news which has a pricetoearnings ratio about half of Enrons times OWS also alleges that Enrons earnings quality is poor and that key parts of its financial statements are confusing and opaque Houstonbased Enron didnt comment by publication time on elements of the report that Detox sent the company An energy analyst who is bullish on Enrons outlook says the OWS report contains fundamental misunderstandings about the energy market and Enrons business model but he says the report does include some groundbreaking and valid insights The analysts firm doesnt give stock recommendations Economies of Scale Why care what Off Wall Street writes compared with say analysts at Merrill Lynch MERNYSE news For one OWS has an excellent track record Particularly sweet was when the tech stocks it had bashed came crashing down It has also shown itself to be well ahead of the curve recommending that clients sell etailer pricelinecom PCLNNasdaq news in June when faith in Internet stocks was at its blindest and their prices at their most insane Pulling Back Enron retreats after long rally Enron with its domination of a burgeoning energy market annual revenue of over billion and impressive earnings growth can hardly be ranked alongside the likes of priceline But OWS thinks Enron is set for a precipitous drop nonetheless Why OWSs main beef is that key profitability measures are in decline Margins on Enrons pretax operating earnings which the companys earnings releases call IBIT or income before interest taxes and other items are falling Total IBIT of million in the first quarter amounted to only of the billion in revenue for the period compared with a margin in the fourth quarter and in the yearearlier period Revenue in the first quarter was nearly quadrupled from the yearearlier period yet IBIT rose only This shrinkage is due to lowermargin trading income making up an increasingly large share of Enrons revenue base OWS thus calculates that for the remainder of Enron needs to generate an extra billion in revenue for each additional penny it makes over its EPS of to reach analysts expectation of The energy analyst counters that OWS apparently hasnt grasped how Enron can continue to increase earnings even when margins shrink It does so simply by increasing volumes as the energy market balloons in size In other words margins may decline but since revenues are so much higher earnings still go up Illustrating this firstquarter EPS of cents was ahead of the yearago figure even though the IBIT margin shrank by percentage points The analyst thinks Enron will make per share in Growing On You In addition the huge growth in the energy market that has so helped Enron is likely to continue for several years according to the analyst He notes that roughly of the electricity available in the US still isnt traded in a market Eventually it will be part of a competitive environment but itll take five to years says the analyst And he believes the extreme volatility in energyrelated commodities that has also benefited Enron will exist for longer than OWS projects Still OWSs point on profitability is bolstered by other profit measures Return on capital net income as a percentage of equity plus debt was in down on s and well below the returns on capital at Duke DUKNYSE news Dynegy DYNNYSE news and even Goldman Even Enron bulls will admit that its financials are hard to follow For example it doesnt give a gross margin number for its wholesale services or trading business which accounts for of revenue But one area of the companys financial statements registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission that consistently bugs analysts is the part that describes Enrons related party transactions which are the deals it does with entities that have some sort of link to the firm In fact one of the related entities that Enron has traded with is headed by Enrons CFO Andrew Fastow The energy analyst comments Why are they doing this Its just inappropriate The reason for maintaining these hardtofollow related party deals has been a source of speculation But OWS analysis shows how a sales of optical fiber to a related party may have been used to goose earnings in the second quarter of Estimated profits from the socalled dark fiber optical cable without the gear to send data over it transaction allowed Enron to beat analysts secondearnings earnings estimate by cents a share rather than missing by cents How soon before Wall Street follows Off Wall Street on Enron

Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas Cc Forwarded by Robert BensonCorpEnron on PM Chris CT PM To Robert NRON cc Subject Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas Forwarded by Chris DorlandHOUECT on PM Dan Dorland AM To Paul CT Jan CT Jeff CT Dave CT Garrett CT Stephane CT Chris CT cc Subject Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas yahoocommentdetoxhtml Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas By Peter Eavis Senior Columnist Originally posted at PM ET on RealMoneycom A small research boutique with a reputation for rigorous analysis is telling clients to quickly dump Enron ENENYSE news believing that the energy trading giants earnings will fall well short of Wall Streets forecasts Cambridge Massbased Off Wall Street led by analyst Mark Roberts thinks Enrons earnings will fall cents short of the consensus estimate of The firm also believes Enron stock should trade around nearly below Wednesdays The firms page report published May highlights Enrons declining profitability and increasing leverage and suggests that the company should trade on the same sort of multiple as a trading firm like Goldman Sachs GS NYSE news which has a pricetoearnings ratio about half of Enrons times OWS also alleges that Enrons earnings quality is poor and that key parts of its financial statements are confusing and opaque Houstonbased Enron didnt comment by publication time on elements of the report that Detox sent the company An energy analyst who is bullish on Enrons outlook says the OWS report contains fundamental misunderstandings about the energy market and Enrons business model but he says the report does include some groundbreaking and valid insights The analysts firm doesnt give stock recommendations Economies of Scale Why care what Off Wall Street writes compared with say analysts at Merrill Lynch MERNYSE news For one OWS has an excellent track record Particularly sweet was when the tech stocks it had bashed came crashing down It has also shown itself to be well ahead of the curve recommending that clients sell etailer pricelinecom PCLNNasdaq news in June when faith in Internet stocks was at its blindest and their prices at their most insane Pulling Back Enron retreats after long rally Enron with its domination of a burgeoning energy market annual revenue of over billion and impressive earnings growth can hardly be ranked alongside the likes of priceline But OWS thinks Enron is set for a precipitous drop nonetheless Why OWSs main beef is that key profitability measures are in decline Margins on Enrons pretax operating earnings which the companys earnings releases call IBIT or income before interest taxes and other items are falling Total IBIT of million in the first quarter amounted to only of the billion in revenue for the period compared with a margin in the fourth quarter and in the yearearlier period Revenue in the first quarter was nearly quadrupled from the yearearlier period yet IBIT rose only This shrinkage is due to lowermargin trading income making up an increasingly large share of Enrons revenue base OWS thus calculates that for the remainder of Enron needs to generate an extra billion in revenue for each additional penny it makes over its EPS of to reach analysts expectation of The energy analyst counters that OWS apparently hasnt grasped how Enron can continue to increase earnings even when margins shrink It does so simply by increasing volumes as the energy market balloons in size In other words margins may decline but since revenues are so much higher earnings still go up Illustrating this firstquarter EPS of cents was ahead of the yearago figure even though the IBIT margin shrank by percentage points The analyst thinks Enron will make per share in Growing On You In addition the huge growth in the energy market that has so helped Enron is likely to continue for several years according to the analyst He notes that roughly of the electricity available in the US still isnt traded in a market Eventually it will be part of a competitive environment but itll take five to years says the analyst And he believes the extreme volatility in energyrelated commodities that has also benefited Enron will exist for longer than OWS projects Still OWSs point on profitability is bolstered by other profit measures Return on capital net income as a percentage of equity plus debt was in down on s and well below the returns on capital at Duke DUKNYSE news Dynegy DYNNYSE news and even Goldman Even Enron bulls will admit that its financials are hard to follow For example it doesnt give a gross margin number for its wholesale services or trading business which accounts for of revenue But one area of the companys financial statements registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission that consistently bugs analysts is the part that describes Enrons related party transactions which are the deals it does with entities that have some sort of link to the firm In fact one of the related entities that Enron has traded with is headed by Enrons CFO Andrew Fastow The energy analyst comments Why are they doing this Its just inappropriate The reason for maintaining these hardtofollow related party deals has been a source of speculation But OWS analysis shows how a sales of optical fiber to a related party may have been used to goose earnings in the second quarter of Estimated profits from the socalled dark fiber optical cable without the gear to send data over it transaction allowed Enron to beat analysts secondearnings earnings estimate by cents a share rather than missing by cents How soon before Wall Street follows Off Wall Street on Enron

quickly dump Enron ENENYSE news believing that the energy trading giants earnings will fall well short of Wall Streets forecasts Cambridge Massbased Off Wall Street led by analyst Mark Roberts thinks in revenue for each additional penny it makes over its EPS of to reach analysts expectation of The energy analyst counters that OWS apparently hasnt grasped how Enron can continue to increase earnings even when margins shrink It does so simply by increasing volumes as the energy market balloons in size In other words margins may decline but since revenues are so much higher earnings still go up Illustrating this firstquarter EPS of cents was ahead of the yearago figure even though the IBIT margin shrank by percentage points The analyst thinks Enron will make per share in Growing On You In addition the huge growth in the energy market that has so helped Enron is likely to continue for several years according to the analyst He notes that roughly of the electricity available in the US still isnt traded in a market Eventually it will be part of a competitive environment but itll take five to years says the analyst And he believes the extreme volatility in energyrelated commodities that has also benefited Enron will exist for longer than OWS projects Still OWSs point on profitability is bolstered by other profit measures Return on capital net income as a percentage of equity plus debt was in down on s and well below the returns on capital at Duke DUKNYSE news Dynegy DYNNYSE news and even Goldman Even Enron bulls will admit that its financials are hard to follow For example it doesnt give a gross margin number for its wholesale services or trading business which accounts for of revenue But one area of the companys financial statements registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission that consistently bugs analysts is the part that describes Enrons related party transactions which are the deals it does with entities that have some sort of link to the firm In fact one of the related entities that Enron has traded with is headed by Enrons CFO Andrew Fastow The energy analyst comments Why are they doing this Its just inappropriate The reason for maintaining these hardtofollow related party deals has been a source of speculation But OWS analysis shows how a sales of optical fiber to a related party may have been used to goose earnings in the second quarter of Estimated profits from the socalled dark fiber optical cable without the gear to send data over it transaction allowed Enron to beat analysts secondearnings earnings estimate by cents a share rather than missing by cents How soon before Wall Street follows Off Wall Street on Enron

Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas Cc Forwarded by Robert BensonCorpEnron on PM Chris CT PM To Robert NRON cc Subject Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas Forwarded by Chris DorlandHOUECT on PM Dan Dorland AM To Paul CT Jan CT Jeff CT Dave CT Garrett CT Stephane CT Chris CT cc Subject Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas yahoocommentdetoxhtml Why One Firm Thinks Enron Is Running Out of Gas By Peter Eavis Senior Columnist Originally posted at PM ET on RealMoneycom A small research boutique with a reputation for rigorous analysis is telling clients to quickly dump Enron ENENYSE news believing that the energy trading giants earnings will fall well short of Wall Streets forecasts Cambridge Massbased Off Wall Street led by analyst Mark Roberts thinks Enrons earnings will fall cents short of the consensus estimate of The firm also believes Enron stock should trade around nearly below Wednesdays The firms page report published May highlights Enrons declining profitability and increasing leverage and suggests that the company should trade on the same sort of multiple as a trading firm like Goldman Sachs GS NYSE news which has a pricetoearnings ratio about half of Enrons times OWS also alleges that Enrons earnings quality is poor and that key parts of its financial statements are confusing and opaque Houstonbased Enron didnt comment by publication time on elements of the report that Detox sent the company An energy analyst who is bullish on Enrons outlook says the OWS report contains fundamental misunderstandings about the energy market and Enrons business model but he says the report does include some groundbreaking and valid insights The analysts firm doesnt give stock recommendations Economies of Scale Why care what Off Wall Street writes compared with say analysts at Merrill Lynch MERNYSE news For one OWS has an excellent track record Particularly sweet was when the tech stocks it had bashed came crashing down It has also shown itself to be well ahead of the curve recommending that clients sell etailer pricelinecom PCLNNasdaq news in June when faith in Internet stocks was at its blindest and their prices at their most insane Pulling Back Enron retreats after long rally Enron with its domination of a burgeoning energy market annual revenue of over billion and impressive earnings growth can hardly be ranked alongside the likes of priceline But OWS thinks Enron is set for a precipitous drop nonetheless Why OWSs main beef is that key profitability measures are in decline Margins on Enrons pretax operating earnings which the companys earnings releases call IBIT or income before interest taxes and other items are falling Total IBIT of million in the first quarter amounted to only of the billion in revenue for the period compared with a margin in the fourth quarter and in the yearearlier period Revenue in the first quarter was nearly quadrupled from the yearearlier period yet IBIT rose only This shrinkage is due to lowermargin trading income making up an increasingly large share of Enrons revenue base OWS thus calculates that for the remainder of Enron needs to generate an extra billion in revenue for each additional penny it makes over its EPS of to reach analysts expectation of The energy analyst counters that OWS apparently hasnt grasped how Enron can continue to increase earnings even when margins shrink It does so simply by increasing volumes as the energy market balloons in size In other words margins may decline but since revenues are so much higher earnings still go up Illustrating this firstquarter EPS of cents was ahead of the yearago figure even though the IBIT margin shrank by percentage points The analyst thinks Enron will make per share in Growing On You In addition the huge growth in the energy market that has so helped Enron is likely to continue for several years according to the analyst He notes that roughly of the electricity available in the US still isnt traded in a market Eventually it will be part of a competitive environment but itll take five to years says the analyst And he believes the extreme volatility in energyrelated commodities that has also benefited Enron will exist for longer than OWS projects Still OWSs point on profitability is bolstered by other profit measures Return on capital net income as a percentage of equity plus debt was in down on s and well below the returns on capital at Duke DUKNYSE news Dynegy DYNNYSE news and even Goldman Even Enron bulls will admit that its financials are hard to follow For example it doesnt give a gross margin number for its wholesale services or trading business which accounts for of revenue But one area of the companys financial statements registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission that consistently bugs analysts is the part that describes Enrons related party transactions which are the deals it does with entities that have some sort of link to the firm In fact one of the related entities that Enron has traded with is headed by Enrons CFO Andrew Fastow The energy analyst comments Why are they doing this Its just inappropriate The reason for maintaining these hardtofollow related party deals has been a source of speculation But OWS analysis shows how a sales of optical fiber to a related party may have been used to goose earnings in the second quarter of Estimated profits from the socalled dark fiber optical cable without the gear to send data over it transaction allowed Enron to beat analysts secondearnings earnings estimate by cents a share rather than missing by cents How soon before Wall Street follows Off Wall Street on Enron

REPST Original Message From Gorny Vladimir Sent Friday February AM To Benson Robert Cc Sturm Fletcher J Subject FW Rob See tab Rob in the attached spreadsheet Same story on Portfolio reducing gas position lowers VaR I have ran two additional scenarios for Portfolio with and of the original gas position Let me know if you have questions Vlady Original Message From Gorny Vladimir Sent Friday February AM To Sturm Fletcher J Subject RE Fletch The limits have been quoted using the d measure However UBS will use all three measures In Portfolio Gas risk overweighs Power risk NGR correlation is If you reduce your NG position risk will come down See portfolio a with day of JV Gas Also see my simple square root of some of squares calc in the updated spreadsheet I will run Robs scenarios sometime today and send it to you Vlady Original Message From Sturm Fletcher J Sent Friday February AM To Gorny Vladimir Subject RE Vladimir Which measure are we going to be using at UBS VaR on portfolio dosnt make sense to me that adding gas short to same position as c increases risk Whats up with that Also could you forward the results from Rob Bensons portfolios to me Thanks Fletch Benson Robert Vladi we need to talk about the PJMGas correlations Could you also give us a correlation matrix all power markets and gas markets Thanks

for the year was set at No losing months worst month was positive Very high return on VAR dont have actual numbers sorry Done two customer load following deals both have turned out to be very profitable Exceeded all EOL goals both number of trades and volume Each month Im in the top in east power for number of trades and volume Have always stayed within my VAR limits I have become the market for all PJM trades both on and off peak My PL has come from intraday trading as well as an underlying fundamental position in both on and off peak PL did not come from just one big move Have RE What up Original Message From Fuller Holly Holly lPasocomENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESFullerCHollyCHollyEFullerElPasoEcomE NRONcom Sent Monday July PM To Benson Robert Subject RE What up Hey Rob sorry if I sounded a little weird on the phone the other night My boyfriend and I were in the middle of a really heavy discussion when you called He was standing right by me upset with me so it was a little awkward It was great to hear from you and Id still like to meet you for a drink sometime after work Take care Holly Benson Robert Hey Holly sorry it has taken me so long to get back to you I went back to Calgary for days Finally toke a vacation Im glad you wrote back I shouldnt have called on a Friday night I hope every thing worked out with your boyfriend Id love to get out with you hows next wed or thurs Talk to ya later Rob This email and any files transmitted with it from the ElPaso Corporation are confidential and intended solely for the use of the individual or entity to whom they are addressed If you have received this email in error please notify the sender

RE you dont need access to stack managerPST Original Message From Diamond Daniel Sent Tuesday February AM To Benson Robert Subject RE you dont need access to stack manager Im glad to hear that you use stack manager but do you have a stand alone computer for stack or do you access it through terminal server see below Dan Original Message From Benson Robert Sent Tuesday February AM To Diamond Daniel Subject RE you dont need access to stack manager Original Message From Diamond Daniel Sent Tuesday February AM To Benson Robert Bishop Serena Brodeur Stephane Coffing Timothy Driscoll Michael M Ermis Frank Fischer Mark Guzman Mark Mallory Chris Slinger Ryan Thomas Paul Thomas Paul D Subject you dont need access to stack manager Importance High I assume that since you didnt respond to my first two emails none of you require access to stack manager If this is incorrect please respond to my previous emails Thanks Dan Subject Waiting on your reply Stack Users If youre receiving this email its because were still waiting on a response from you Please reply to this message ASAP See below for details Thanks Dan We are in the process of confirming that all traders are set up correctly and ready to trade when the system goes live We need to make sure that your Stack Managers are accessing the correct database In order to do this we need to know how you access Stack Manager Through Terminal Server the one that opens up a desktop within a desktop and it actually appears that you have two Start buttons or By opening the Stack Manager directly from your native desktop stand alone computer Please reply to this message with either a corresponding or a in the subject field If youre not sure which one you have please contact myself x Teresa Mandola x or Jennifer McQuade x and well come by your desk to help you Thank you Dan Diamond Benson Robert I use the stack manager I actually open seperate stack managers Benson Robert

ranked alongside the likes of priceline But OWS thinks Enron is set for a precipitous drop nonetheless Why OWSs main beef is that key profitability measures are in decline Margins on Enrons pretax operating earnings which the companys earnings releases call IBIT or income before interest taxes and other items are falling Total IBIT of million in the first quarter amounted to only of the billion in revenue for the period compared with a margin in the fourth quarter and in the yearearlier period Revenue in the first quarter was nearly quadrupled from the yearearlier period yet IBIT rose only This shrinkage is due to lowermargin trading income making up an increasingly large share of Enrons revenue base OWS thus calculates that for the remainder of Enron needs to generate an extra billion in revenue for each additional penny it makes over its EPS of to reach analysts expectation of The energy analyst counters that OWS apparently hasnt grasped how Enron can continue to increase earnings even when margins shrink It does so simply by increasing volumes as the energy market balloons in size In other words margins may decline but since revenues are so much higher earnings still go up Illustrating this firstquarter EPS of cents was ahead of the yearago figure even though the IBIT margin shrank by percentage points The analyst thinks Enron will make per share in Growing On You In addition the huge growth in the energy market that has so helped Enron is likely to continue for several years according to the analyst He notes that roughly of the electricity available in the US still isnt traded in a market Eventually it will be part of a competitive environment but itll take five to years says the analyst And he believes the extreme volatility in energyrelated commodities that has also benefited Enron will exist for longer than OWS projects Still OWSs point on profitability is bolstered by other profit measures Return on capital net income as a percentage of equity plus debt was in down on s and well below the returns on capital at Duke DUKNYSE news Dynegy DYNNYSE news and even Goldman Even Enron bulls will admit that its financials are hard to follow For example it doesnt give a gross margin number for its wholesale services or trading business which accounts for of revenue But one area of the companys financial statements registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission that consistently bugs analysts is the part that describes Enrons related party transactions which are the deals it does with entities that have some sort of link to the firm In fact one of the related entities that Enron has traded with is headed by Enrons CFO Andrew Fastow The energy analyst comments Why are they doing this Its just inappropriate The reason for maintaining these hardtofollow related party deals has been a source of speculation But OWS analysis shows how a sales of optical fiber to a related party may have been used to goose earnings in the
